- - - EXAMINATION

Good morning, ma'am.  My name is Steven Levy, and I represent the plaintiff in a lawsuit that they've brought against you. I'm here to take your deposition regarding a car accident. Have you ever given deposition testimony before?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm just going to go through some basic instructions.  The first one is make sure you give all of your responses verbally to the interpreter.
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you speak or understand any English?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: We're going to do our best to all speak one at a time today.  Make sure you let me get my question out, wait for the interpretation to be complete before you answer the question.

text: That's fine, yes.

speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Well, I was there in my position of parking and I don't know and he just rushed from behind.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever actually see the car with your eyes before feeling an impact?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't see any car immediately behind.  He's far away.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: My question is just what type of vehicle hit your vehicle.
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't remember what kind of car it was.  Maybe it was a cream color.  I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know if it was a sedan or a big SUV or truck, medium-sized car?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't recall.  I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where were you looking when you felt the impact?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: When the impact happened, I was parking.  Then after it, I felt the impact and looked in the mirror and, oh, my God, the guy hit me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Which direction were your eyes facing right before you felt the impact?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Well, I just tried to park.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Ma'am, that's not my question.  My question is very specific. Were where you actually looking right before the impact happened?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Looking in the front because I wanted to move back in and look in the front.  I wanted to park.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Could you see the vehicle that hit you right before it hit you?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, because I was looking in the front, because where I was sitting in my car parked, I didn't see his car.  I didn't see there is a car behind.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I thought you told me before your car was moving backwards at the time of the impact?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes, because I was planning to park, and meantime I'm looking in the front at the mirror.  I didn't see any vehicle coming up.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At the actual moment where you felt the impact, was your vehicle moving backwards at that time?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, my car was on, but I was in a state of trying to park, like move a little bit and pause, that kind of state.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: He wants to know was your car in reverse, in drive, or were you parked or something else when the actual impact occurred.
speaker: MS. KOSCIELNIAK

text: Yes, it was in reverse, and then I reverse and pause, reverse and pause.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When the actual impact happened, what pedal is your foot on?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: My foot was on the brake, kind of hold it a little bit.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: As the impact was just about to happen, could you see in your rear-view mirror?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Are you asking her if it was possible she was looking, or was she actually looking?
speaker: MS. KOSCIELNIAK

text: Was she actually looking.
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes, before that, yes.  I look in the mirror.  I didn't see any car.  Prior to the incident happen, I look in the mirror.  I didn't see any car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever see the car that hit you before the impact?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, I did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have any idea the speed of that vehicle?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I can tell you he's in a hard speed, very, very.  I felt that he didn't even realize my car was there and just very hard.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that based solely on what the force of the impact felt like?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: We can agree it was a very hard impact?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes, he slammed into my car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was the point of impact on your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: On the side of my rear part.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have any idea which lane that vehicle was in leading up to the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Do you have any idea which vehicle?
speaker: THE INTERPRETER

text: The striking vehicle.
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I think that he's on the same lane where I was, and after the impact, his car was kind of just facing the other side.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How did your car move as a result of the impact?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Same spot where I was, and he was hitting it towards the outside.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did your car get pushed forward at all?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I think that maybe I'd been pushed forward just a little bit, but I was trying to park.  His car was pretty hard coming from behind.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have any warning that an impact was about to occur, such as a honking horn or screeching tires?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, none of that stuff.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How did your body move during the impact?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I shook up like that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you hit anything inside of the car?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, I didn't, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you injured in this accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever go to a hospital to get checked out or anything like that?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were there any witnesses to the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't think so.  I don't think any witness.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What happened right after?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I think that after the accident he called the police and the cop came over and took the report.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did your husband come out?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes, he came out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did he see the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, he did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did he say whether he heard the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, he was inside the house.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How did he learn of the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Well, after the accident happened, he was ready to come out, so he saw my car outside.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have a phone with you in the car?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes, I have phone in my car, but I did not make a phone call.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you called your husband or when he called you rather, were you driving when you took that call?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No.  When my husband called me, I was planning to shop.  Then he called, so I told him I will be back in about 20 minutes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have any type of hands-free or bluetooth system in the car?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, I don't have none of that stuff.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you call your husband to tell him you were getting close?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, because I know how much time it's going to take him to get ready.  So I was going to call him after I parked the car and let him know that I'm here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You hadn't done that yet when the accident took place?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: That's correct, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't know because my husband and son took care of all that stuff.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was your phone number at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Has that changed since the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Has your phone service provider changed since the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't know.  I'm not sure.  Probably they did.  My son took care of all that stuff.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What's your son's name?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Jason Zheng, Z-H-E-N-G.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does he live with you?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Other than police and your husband, did anyone else come to the area where the cars were after?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, I don't pay attention to that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How many people were in the other car?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Two women.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you speak to either of them?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Well, because I don't speak English, I couldn't communicate, didn't say anything with them, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What were they doing after the accident took place?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Can you repeat that?  I felt that after the accident they were getting out of the car and cursing.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: My question is, what did you observe them doing?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't understand what they were saying, but I know they were angry.  They were cursing and yelling.  As soon as we got out of the car, they were cursing and got angry.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long did it take for the police to arrive?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Not long.  Maybe between five to ten minutes, not long.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did the police speak to you at all?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: They did.  The cop did speak to me, but I didn't understand what they say.  So all I remember is they want my insurance information, my license and all that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At any point, did you say anything to the police officers about how the accident happened?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Because my language barrier, I'm not sure.  I give a description to the police officer.  I just did the best I can to give the depiction, but I don't think I say that much because my language barrier.  I provided the information that they asked for.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The police officer wrote down in the police report, referring to your vehicle, unit 2, that you stated you were parked with your hazard lights on the in the right lane?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, it's not true.  It's a reverse light.  It was a turning light.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Just to be clear, you never told that to them?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did tow trucks come to the scene?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Towed their vehicle, right?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I don't know.  I'm asking you.
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I didn't see any tow truck because I saw these two women.  They were outside, and the cop came and took the report.  I didn't think it was going to be that serious, so I didn't think too much about the other stuff.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No.

text: What do you want me to do with these?

text: First, just take a look at each one, and then I'll ask you some questions.
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes, that's the damage.  That's exactly what I told you earlier.  That is where my car got hit.  That's the damage for my vehicle in the rear.

text: Indicating D-3.

text: Do all three of these pictures show the vehicle you were driving at the time of the accident?

text: I didn't take any pictures myself. Maybe my husband took them.

text: These may have been taken by my client.
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Okay.

text: Yes.

text: In all three of those pictures, correct?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Correct, yes.

text: I'm going to object. Are you asking her whether the pictures depict the property damage sustained to the vehicle after the accident?
speaker: MS. KOSCIELNIAK

text: I'm just asking if these pictures show the vehicle right after the accident.
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: He wants to know, in all three of these pictures, is this what your car looked like after the accident occurred?
speaker: MS. KOSCIELNIAK

text: Yes, that's where I tried to park, correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Stick with D-1 for right now, this picture. Where your Audi is in that picture, is that where it was when you were hit?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I'm not sure.  I'm not sure whether -- I don't remember whether this was exactly the position my car was at at the time of the accident.  I'm not sure if it was moved forward a little bit or backwards a little bit, but I was in the state of trying to park.  That's all I can tell you.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: After the impact occurred, did you ever move your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't know.  I don't remember exactly because my foot was on the brake when it happened.  I'm not sure if my car was pushed forward or if I moved my car.  I don't remember now.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember pulling it over before the police arrived?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't think I moved too far.  Maybe just a little bit.  Anyway, it was right within the area of where the accident actually happened.  I didn't think I moved too much.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: This picture is close to where the accident happened, correct?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I'm going to object to that question.  My client testified she does not know who took this photograph or when it was taken.
speaker: MS. KOSCIELNIAK

text: Yeah, but she can see the photograph and compare.  She knows where the accident happened, and she can see in this picture where it is. I'm just asking her to compare those two.  I didn't ask where the actual person was when they took it.
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Do you understand the question?
speaker: MS. KOSCIELNIAK

text: Yes, I understand the question.  I think he's trying to ask me whether my car moved.  Yes, because my foot was on the brake.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever have to give a statement to your insurance company after the accident that they told you would be recorded?

text: No, I don't think it was a recorded statement.  They just asked me how it happened.  I give them the description.

text: Did you have an interpreter for that?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes, they have interpreters.  Yes, that's what the interpreter told the insurance agent.

speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes.

text: Do you know how much that cost?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't know the cost because my husband took care of all that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know if there was any damage to your vehicle that we can't see in these photographs?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't think so, no.  I don't know. I don't remember all that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does your husband speak English?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No.

text: Just my husband and me.  That's all.

text: Did he speak to either of the people in the other car?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, he didn't talk to them.  He just give the police the identification documents to let the police handle everything.

text: Can we take a break for a second.
speaker: MS. KOSCIELNIAK

text: (Whereupon, a break was taken at this time.)
Earlier, counsel asked you if any other family members came to the scene of the accident other than your husband. Did anyone else come to the scene?
speaker: MS. KOSCIELNIAK

text: Yes, I'm sorry, it was my husband.  He probably called my son to come to the scene.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does your son speak English?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see him speaking to anyone at the scene?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't know.  I wasn't paying too much attention.  I don't know.  I'm not so certain because I think my son just looked at the damage on my car.  Maybe he spoke to the cop briefly.  I'm not sure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did he speak to the other driver?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: I don't know, no.  I didn't pay attention to that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see how the other driver left the scene of the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Like I said, I didn't pay attention. I think maybe the cop took the report, and then they just left.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you seen or spoken to them since the day of the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: No, I don't think so, no.  I don't remember that.  All I remember is they were very vicious, and they were cursing, yelling and very bad attitude.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember anything specific they said?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Well, I didn't understand the words, but I can tell from expression, the way they were acting.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Specifically, the driver of the vehicle, how was that person moving at the scene of the accident?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: My impression was, even if I don't understand English, I can tell they got out of the car and were cursing, yelling.  They were just very, very bad.  The whole time nonstop cursing, and they were just standing there cursing and yelling.  I didn't see any visible injury.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It was two people, you said?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Yes, two women.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: They were both behaving as you described?
speaker: MR. LEVY

text: Well, the impression I have was they're looking at me very mean and cursing and very not friendly at all.  I never seen any injuries visible that I can observe.

text: I don't have any further questions.
